headline: The Score: Meta Platforms, McDonald’s, Kohl’s and More Stocks That Defined the Week
summary: Facebook parent  Meta Platforms  and  Microsoft  on Wednesday posted better-than-expected results that reassured investors and boosted markets.  Meta said growth would remain steady, assuaging concerns that tariffs would hurt the social-media company’s digital-ads business.  Microsoft indicated that big corporate clients aren’t slashing their technology budgets just yet.

Meta said growth would remain steady, assuaging concerns that tariffs would hurt the social-media company’s digital-ads business.  Microsoft indicated that big corporate clients aren’t slashing their technology budgets just yet.

headline: Why Are Meta (META) Shares Soaring Today
summary: Shares of social network operator Meta Platforms (NASDAQ:META) jumped 5.3% in the afternoon session after the major indices rebounded, with stocks recouping some more of the post-tariff losses as the Bureau of Labor Statistics data revealed a resilient labor market. Non-farm payrolls rose by 177,000 in April 2025, significantly above the consensus forecast of 133,000.

Non-farm payrolls rose by 177,000 in April 2025, significantly above the consensus forecast of 133,000.

headline: US exceptionalism trade is 'still in play': May investing tips
summary: Markets (^GSPC, ^IXIC, ^DJI) are shifting as investors weigh hot labor data and lingering inflation against long-term growth strategies. Andrew Briggs, CFP and Wealth Advisor at Steward Partners, shares why staying invested and reassessing exposure to the Magnificent Seven — the group of tech stocks comprised of Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), Apple (AAPL), Nvidia (NVDA), Tesla (TSLA), Amazon (AMZN), Meta Platforms (META), and Microsoft (MSFT) — may be key in navigating today’s uncertainty. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here.

headline: META Q1 Earnings Call: AI Investment Drives Growth but Guidance Misses Expectations
summary: Social network operator Meta Platforms (NASDAQ:META) reported Q1 CY2025 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 16.1% year on year to $42.31 billion. On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $44 billion was less impressive, coming in 0.9% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $7.69 per share was 47.7% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: META Q1 Earnings Call: AI Investment Drives Growth but Guidance Misses Expectations
raw.summary: Social network operator Meta Platforms (NASDAQ:META) reported Q1 CY2025 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 16.1% year on year to $42.31 billion. On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $44 billion was less impressive, coming in 0.9% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $7.69 per share was 47.7% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Meta’s (META) Reality Labs Continue to Bleed Billions
summary: Meta’s (META) ambitious push into the metaverse is proving to be an expensive journey. In its latest quarter results, Meta’s Reality Labs division posted another steep loss, highlighting ongoing challenges. Despite CEO Mark Zuckerberg’s long-term vision and multibillion-dollar investments, both revenues and investor patience appear to be wearing thin. Overall, Meta reported strong Q1 FY2025 results. Adjusted earnings per share came in at $6.43, significantly beating Wall Street’s estimate of $5.

raw.headline: Meta’s (META) Reality Labs Continue to Bleed Billions
raw.summary: Meta’s (META) ambitious push into the metaverse is proving to be an expensive journey. Despite CEO Mark Zuckerberg’s long-term vision and multibillion-dollar investments, both revenues and investor patience appear to be wearing thin. Overall, Meta reported strong Q1 FY2025 results. Adjusted earnings per share came in at $6.43, significantly beating Wall Street’s estimate of $5.
